items.question: Was that really Michael Cera or a double in the snorkel mask during the swimming pool scene with Jason Bateman in season 5?
Why was it cancelled?
items.answer: Arrested Development's ratings were low by Fox's standards and they dropped the show. Showtime made an offer to air a fourth season, but the creator Mitchell Hurwitz declined, claiming to be burnt out on the show.Fifteen new episodes were released exclusively on Netflix on May 26, 2013, and in 2018-2019 a fifth season was released.

items.question: Where can I watch the show for free online?
items.answer: If you have the new windows vista, just go to the windows media center. all three seasons are on there for free. Just go into Internet Tv, go to tv, Under tv go to series, and you will see all three seasons available for free. The shows only have two 30 second commercials in between.You can also go to hulu.com, which has all of season 1 and 2 available for streaming, with only a few commercials in between. On October 9th, 2009, season 2 will no longer be showing on hulu.com, but season 1 will still be available.TVShack.net has all the seasons, without commercials, but they are missing a few episodes (9-11 I believe) of Season 3.All episodes can also be found at the following link: http://arresteddevelopment.msn.com/Hulu airs each season in rotation. I believe it is currently airing seaons 3 (2/3/2011)If you have a Netflix Instant Streaming account you are able to watch all four seasons online on a Netflix supported device such as Windows, the Play Station 3, Xbox 360, or an Nintendo Wii.

items.question: In the second episode they burn the banana stand but in later episodes, it's still standing. How?
items.answer: If you're asking this, then you've probably been skipping the "On the next Arrested Development" segments. They're not actually previews for the next episode, they're conclusions to the story. The banana stand was rebuilt in the "On the next" segment of the second episode, Top Banana.

items.question: What happened to Michael's wife?
items.answer: Tracy Bluth died 2 years before the show began, after a coma (according to the episode "For British Eyes Only") while suffering from ovarian cancer (implied in the episode "Prison Break-In"). The episode "Whistler's Mother" implies Michael and Tracy knew each other since high school, if not earlier, and the episode "Public Relations" reveals they married during his second year of college. According to Gob in "The Immaculate Election", Michael had knocked her up before they married. Tracy is played by Maria Thayer in the season 4 episode "It Gets Better," her debut on the show in person.

items.question: What is GOB's magic show theme?
What is that song that plays in season 1 when Michael goes to the award show with Marta, and when he steals a chair? It's something about sunshine.
items.answer: It was written specifically for this show by its composor David Schwartz. It's called "You Here With Me." An instrumental version (without lyrics) can be heard in Beef Consomme and much later in Exit Strategy.

items.question: What is that song that plays when George Michael learns he has to share a room with Maeby, and when Ann asks him for sex?
What's that song that plays twice in Key Decisions, when GOB gets stabbed at the end?
What is the song GOB keeps thinking of in season 4?
items.answer: "The Sound of Silence" by Simon & Garfunkel

items.question: Are the DVDs/Netflix episodes bleeped?
items.answer: The bleeps are a joke, so they're kept on the DVDs and Netflix, with one exception. You can watch either the TV version of the Pilot or the Extended Pilot on DVD. The TV version's bleeped, and the extended version isn't.

items.question: What special features are there on the DVDs?
items.answer: Deleted scenes for most episodes, commentaries for three episodes per season (the Pilot, Beef Consomme, Let 'em Eat Cake, Good Grief, Ready, Aim, Marry Me, The Righteous Brothers, 2 Rita episodes and Development Arrested), some documentaries, and blooper reels for seasons 2 and 3.

items.question: Notes on names.
items.answer: Fünke is not a real surname, but Funke (without an umlaut) is a German surname.Buster's real name is Byron Bluth."Gob" (pronounced "jobe") is from his initials: George Oscar Bluth."Annyong" is the Korean word for "hello," ironically, his real name is "Hel-loh."Maeby's real name is Mae Fünke.Lucille Bluth is called "Gangy" by Maeby and George Michael, a slang term for grandmother.George Sr. is often referred to as Pop-Pop by George Michael and Maeby.

items.question: How much time elapsed between season 3 and season 4?
items.answer: At least seven years. This gap in between years is referred to in Season 4 as "the great dark period".

items.question: In which episode was there a reference to George Michael the musical artist?
items.answer: Season one episode 10, "Pier Pressure". There are more references in the fourth season, including Flight of the Phoenix.

items.question: How rich are the Bluth family?
items.answer: Throughout the series, they are rich enough to afford a glamorous lifestyle. Gob once used the company's money to buy a boat. However, it has also been mentioned that they couldn't afford to buy a new car or a new house. When George Sr. was in charge of the company, it likely made a lot of money. After he went to jail, Lucille Bluth secretly ran the company and likely was able to keep the cash flowing. It has been a running gag in the series that the family are not really rich, and each member of the family embezzles money from Bluth businesses in their own creative way.

items.question: Has this show revealed secrets behind magic tricks?
items.answer: Yes. Examples include the "Saw-the-woman-in-half" trick, the "Aztec Tomb", escape from the coffin trick, and others. But most of these are common sense solutions to the magic tricks, and not anything really important.

items.question: Is there any site that has in-depth information about the show?
items.answer: http://the-op.com/ is a good fansite. The Wikipedia articles about the show and its characters are also highly informative and are being maintained by dedicated users.

spoilerItems.question: What happened to Annyong?
spoilerItems.answer: Annyong, who was adopted by Lucille in the middle of season 1, appears in some episodes in the early second season, but in Afternoon Delight Lucille says she sent him to the Milford Academy boarding school. This was to teach him a lesson, but she can't remember about what. In season 3, Annyong returns as a mole, spying on the family, and is instrumental in getting Lucille arrested in the season finale.

spoilerItems.question: When did George Michael and Maeby find out that they weren't blood relatives?
spoilerItems.answer: In the first half of season one, George Michael learned that Maeby might have been made in a test tube and might not be Lindsay's biological daughter, and therefore might not really be his cousin. He decided to not share this information with Maeby until the second-to-the-last episode, "Exit Strategy," which led to them going to second base. At the end of that episode, they saw the birth pictures which proved that Maeby was Lindsay's biological daughter. However, in the final episode, "Development Arrested," it was revealed that Lindsay was adopted. At the end of Season 5, we learn that Lindsay is Lucille's half-sister, so George-Michael and Maeby are blood-related after all.
